intro: Corispermum pungens, commonly known as the spiny bladderwrath, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in racemes, producing small, capsule-like fruits. Corispermum pungens is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with mechanisms to store water and reduce transpiration.
